segment.source: 4672(S) Special privileges assigned to new logon.
segment.target: 4672(S) Special privileges assigned to new logon.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4672(S) Special privileges assigned to new logon.
segment.target: Describes security event 4672(S) Special privileges assigned to new logon.

segment.source: 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.
segment.target: 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates for new account logons if any of the following sensitive privileges are assigned to the new logon session:
segment.target: This event generates for new account logons if any of the following sensitive privileges are assigned to the new logon session:

segment.source: SeTcbPrivilege - Act as part of the operating system
segment.target: SeTcbPrivilege - Act as part of the operating system

segment.source: SeBackupPrivilege - Back up files and directories
segment.target: SeBackupPrivilege - Back up files and directories

segment.source: SeCreateTokenPrivilege - Create a token object
segment.target: SeCreateTokenPrivilege - Create a token object

segment.source: SeDebugPrivilege - Debug programs
segment.target: SeDebugPrivilege - Debug programs

segment.source: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege - Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
segment.target: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege - Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation

segment.source: SeAuditPrivilege - Generate security audits
segment.target: SeAuditPrivilege - Generate security audits

segment.source: SeImpersonatePrivilege - Impersonate a client after authentication
segment.target: SeImpersonatePrivilege - Impersonate a client after authentication

segment.source: SeLoadDriverPrivilege - Load and unload device drivers
segment.target: SeLoadDriverPrivilege - Load and unload device drivers

segment.source: SeSecurityPrivilege - Manage auditing and security log
segment.target: SeSecurityPrivilege - Manage auditing and security log

segment.source: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege - Modify firmware environment values
segment.target: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege - Modify firmware environment values

segment.source: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege - Replace a process-level token
segment.target: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege - Replace a process-level token

segment.source: SeRestorePrivilege - Restore files and directories,
segment.target: SeRestorePrivilege - Restore files and directories,

segment.source: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege - Take ownership of files or other objects
segment.target: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege - Take ownership of files or other objects

segment.source: You typically will see many of these events in the event log, because every logon of SYSTEM (Local System) account triggers this event.
segment.target: You typically will see many of these events in the event log, because every logon of SYSTEM (Local System) account triggers this event.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Subject:
segment.target: Subject:

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account to which special privileges were assigned.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account to which special privileges were assigned.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).
segment.target: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).

segment.source: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.
segment.target: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.

segment.source: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.
segment.target: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.

segment.source: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.
segment.target: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.

segment.source: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.
segment.target: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.

segment.source: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.
segment.target: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account to which special privileges were assigned.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account to which special privileges were assigned.

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO
segment.target: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO

segment.source: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local
segment.target: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local

segment.source: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL
segment.target: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL

segment.source: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.
segment.target: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.

segment.source: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.
segment.target: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.

segment.source: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”
segment.target: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”

segment.source: Privileges Type = UnicodeString: the list of sensitive privileges, assigned to the new logon.
segment.target: Privileges Type = UnicodeString: the list of sensitive privileges, assigned to the new logon.

segment.source: The following table contains the list of possible privileges for this event:
segment.target: The following table contains the list of possible privileges for this event:

segment.source: Privilege Name
segment.target: Privilege Name

segment.source: User Right Group Policy Name
segment.target: User Right Group Policy Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege
segment.target: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege

segment.source: Replace a process-level token
segment.target: Replace a process-level token

segment.source: Required to assign the primary token of a process.
segment.target: Required to assign the primary token of a process.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can initiate a process to replace the default token associated with a started subprocess.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can initiate a process to replace the default token associated with a started subprocess.

segment.source: SeAuditPrivilege
segment.target: SeAuditPrivilege

segment.source: Generate security audits
segment.target: Generate security audits

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can add entries to the security log.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can add entries to the security log.

segment.source: SeBackupPrivilege
segment.target: SeBackupPrivilege

segment.source: Back up files and directories
segment.target: Back up files and directories

segment.source: - Required to perform backup operations.
segment.target: - Required to perform backup operations.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.

segment.source: This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file.
segment.target: This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file.

segment.source: Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL.
segment.target: Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL.

segment.source: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
segment.target: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:

segment.source: READCONTROL
segment.target: READCONTROL

segment.source: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY
segment.target: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY

segment.source: FILEGENERICREAD
segment.target: FILEGENERICREAD

segment.source: FILETRAVERSE
segment.target: FILETRAVERSE

segment.source: SeCreateTokenPrivilege
segment.target: SeCreateTokenPrivilege

segment.source: Create a token object
segment.target: Create a token object

segment.source: Allows a process to create a token which it can then use to get access to any local resources when the process uses NtCreateToken() or other token-creation APIs.
segment.target: Allows a process to create a token which it can then use to get access to any local resources when the process uses NtCreateToken() or other token-creation APIs.

segment.source: When a process requires this privilege, we recommend using the LocalSystem account (which already includes the privilege), rather than creating a separate user account and assigning this privilege to it.
segment.target: When a process requires this privilege, we recommend using the LocalSystem account (which already includes the privilege), rather than creating a separate user account and assigning this privilege to it.

segment.source: SeDebugPrivilege
segment.target: SeDebugPrivilege

segment.source: Debug programs
segment.target: Debug programs

segment.source: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account.
segment.target: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel.

segment.source: Developers who are debugging their own applications do not need this user right.
segment.target: Developers who are debugging their own applications do not need this user right.

segment.source: Developers who are debugging new system components need this user right.
segment.target: Developers who are debugging new system components need this user right.

segment.source: This user right provides complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.
segment.target: This user right provides complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.

segment.source: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege
segment.target: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege

segment.source: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
segment.target: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation

segment.source: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation.
segment.target: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can set the Trusted for Delegation setting on a user or computer object.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can set the Trusted for Delegation setting on a user or computer object.

segment.source: The user or object that is granted this privilege must have write access to the account control flags on the user or computer object.
segment.target: The user or object that is granted this privilege must have write access to the account control flags on the user or computer object.

segment.source: A server process running on a computer (or under a user context) that is trusted for delegation can access resources on another computer using the delegated credentials of a client, as long as the account of the client does not have the Account cannot be delegated account control flag set.
segment.target: A server process running on a computer (or under a user context) that is trusted for delegation can access resources on another computer using the delegated credentials of a client, as long as the account of the client does not have the Account cannot be delegated account control flag set.

segment.source: SeImpersonatePrivilege
segment.target: SeImpersonatePrivilege

segment.source: Impersonate a client after authentication
segment.target: Impersonate a client after authentication

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can impersonate other accounts.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can impersonate other accounts.

segment.source: SeLoadDriverPrivilege
segment.target: SeLoadDriverPrivilege

segment.source: Load and unload device drivers
segment.target: Load and unload device drivers

segment.source: Required to load or unload a device driver.
segment.target: Required to load or unload a device driver.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.

segment.source: This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.
segment.target: This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.

segment.source: SeRestorePrivilege
segment.target: SeRestorePrivilege

segment.source: Restore files and directories
segment.target: Restore files and directories

segment.source: Required to perform restore operations.
segment.target: Required to perform restore operations.

segment.source: This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file.
segment.target: This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file.

segment.source: Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL.
segment.target: Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL.

segment.source: Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file.
segment.target: Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file.

segment.source: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
segment.target: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:

segment.source: WRITEDAC
segment.target: WRITEDAC

segment.source: WRITEOWNER
segment.target: WRITEOWNER

segment.source: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY
segment.target: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY

segment.source: FILEGENERICWRITE
segment.target: FILEGENERICWRITE

segment.source: FILEADDFILE
segment.target: FILEADDFILE

segment.source: FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY
segment.target: FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY

segment.source: DELETE
segment.target: DELETE

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when restoring backed up files and directories and determines which users can set any valid security principal as the owner of an object.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when restoring backed up files and directories and determines which users can set any valid security principal as the owner of an object.

segment.source: SeSecurityPrivilege
segment.target: SeSecurityPrivilege

segment.source: Manage auditing and security log
segment.target: Manage auditing and security log

segment.source: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit events in security event log.
segment.target: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit events in security event log.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can specify object access auditing options for individual resources, such as files, Active Directory objects, and registry keys.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can specify object access auditing options for individual resources, such as files, Active Directory objects, and registry keys.

segment.source: A user with this privilege can also view and clear the security log.
segment.target: A user with this privilege can also view and clear the security log.

segment.source: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege
segment.target: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege

segment.source: Modify firmware environment values
segment.target: Modify firmware environment values

segment.source: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information.
segment.target: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information.

segment.source: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege
segment.target: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege

segment.source: Take ownership of files or other objects
segment.target: Take ownership of files or other objects

segment.source: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access.
segment.target: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access.

segment.source: This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object.
segment.target: This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can take ownership of any securable object in the system, including Active Directory objects, files and folders, printers, registry keys, processes, and threads.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can take ownership of any securable object in the system, including Active Directory objects, files and folders, printers, registry keys, processes, and threads.

segment.source: SeTcbPrivilege
segment.target: SeTcbPrivilege

segment.source: Act as part of the operating system
segment.target: Act as part of the operating system

segment.source: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base.
segment.target: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base.

segment.source: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication.
segment.target: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication.

segment.source: The process can therefore gain access to the same local resources as that user.
segment.target: The process can therefore gain access to the same local resources as that user.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.
segment.target: For 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.

segment.source: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.
segment.target: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.

segment.source: Monitor for this event where “SubjectSecurity ID” is not one of these well-known security principals: LOCAL SYSTEM, NETWORK SERVICE, LOCAL SERVICE, and where “SubjectSecurity ID” is not an administrative account that is expected to have the listed Privileges.
segment.target: Monitor for this event where “SubjectSecurity ID” is not one of these well-known security principals: LOCAL SYSTEM, NETWORK SERVICE, LOCAL SERVICE, and where “SubjectSecurity ID” is not an administrative account that is expected to have the listed Privileges.

segment.source: If you have a list of specific privileges which should never be granted, or granted only to a few accounts (for example, SeDebugPrivilege), use this event to monitor for those “Privileges.”
segment.target: If you have a list of specific privileges which should never be granted, or granted only to a few accounts (for example, SeDebugPrivilege), use this event to monitor for those “Privileges.”

segment.source: If you are required to monitor any of the sensitive privileges in the Event Description for this event, search for those specific privileges in the event.
segment.target: If you are required to monitor any of the sensitive privileges in the Event Description for this event, search for those specific privileges in the event.
